intro: Ruyschiana ruyschiana, commonly known as the narrow-leafed rockrose, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant features small, evergreen leaves that are typically narrow and arranged in a spiral pattern along the stems. Its flowers are usually pink or white, with five petals and a showy appearance, blooming in spring. Ruyschiana ruyschiana is adapted to rocky and well-drained soils, often found in mountainous regions.
